intro: Cynanchum blyttioides, commonly known as Blytt's milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-white flowers clustered in umbels. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Cynanchum blyttioides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
